summary: Internal FBI email chain from August 7, 2019, discussing operational planning for a search warrant execution at Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, in the U.S. Virgin Islands. It details logistics, personnel, and case status updates, including that most co-conspirators have been served and digital evidence is being processed.

persons.name: Christina M. Bedford
persons.context: FBI agent from the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking Unit (CACHTU) sending and forwarding operational approval and updates regarding the Epstein investigation and the planned search of Little St. James island.

persons.name: Sean P. Watson
persons.context: FBI agent in the New York office, recipient of an email detailing case updates and the operational plan for the Virgin Islands search warrant.

persons.name: Leonard Carollo
persons.context: FBI agent (CID) who is a recipient of a Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCN) update regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; his private island, Little St. James, is the target of the planned FBI search warrant.

connections.description: FBI colleagues communicating about operational planning and case updates for the Epstein investigation.
FBI colleagues; Bedford is forwarding a sensitive case notification (SCN) regarding Epstein to Carollo.
The FBI team is conducting an investigation, planning a search warrant, and processing evidence related to Epstein.

events.title: Warrant Swearing in St. Thomas
events.description: Case agents are sent to St. Thomas to swear out the search warrant for Little St. James island.

events.title: FBI Team Deployment to Virgin Islands
events.description: Planned for the main FBI team to fly down on an FBI Q400 plane to St. Thomas in preparation for executing the search warrant.

events.title: Planned Search Warrant Execution on Little St. James
events.description: Scheduled execution of the search warrant at 6am on Epstein's private island, Little St. James, anticipated to take 1-3 days.

events.title: SCN Update Regarding Island Search
events.description: A Sensitive Compartmented Information notification (SCN) was updated with information regarding the planned search of Epstein's island.

locations: Little St. James (Epstein's private island, U.S. Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The FBI was planning a large-scale search operation involving approximately 40 personnel at Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, in August 2019.
Most co-conspirators in the case had been served, with one exception being a British citizen who was 'out of pocket.'
Digital media seized from Epstein's residence was being processed by CART and was nearly ready for review.
The FBI was coordinating with multiple entities for the island search, including Customs and Border Protection (CBP), the Coast Guard, and local Virgin Islands authorities.
The operational plan involved securing the warrant on a Friday, flying the main team down on Sunday, and executing the search at 6am on Monday morning.
